subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Crowdfunding: The People's Investment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Crowdfunding: The People's Investment.

hook.text: Pebble Watch raised $10M on Kickstarter in 2012. No VCs neededâ€”just 68,929 regular people.

buildup.text: Crowdfunding lets anyone pledge money for a product, often in exchange for early access.

discovery.text: Reward-based (Kickstarter), equity-based (Republic), and donation-based (GoFundMe) are different models.

twist.text: Crowdfunding isn't free money. Campaigns that succeed spend weeks on marketing before they launch.

climax.text: Oculus Rift crowdfunded $2.4M, then sold to Facebook for $2B. Backers got the product, not equity.

punchline.text: Crowdfunding tests demand with real dollars, not opinions.

quiz.question: What makes crowdfunding an effective validation tool?
options: It tests demand with real money commitments from actual potential customers
It guarantees a successful product launch
It replaces the need for any other funding
